modal.title: Company Relocation
modal.text: We inform you that Isotex Group has changed its location. All our services and products remain unchanged.

shortinfo.experience: Experience. We have nearly 30 years of experience in the industry.
shortinfo.technology: Technology. We manufacture efficient and safe products.
shortinfo.quality: Quality. We offer high-quality insulation products. We are ISO 9001 certified.
shortinfo.complexity: Complexity. We handle sales, design, production, and installation of insulation.

item1.title: Experience
item1.desc: We have nearly 30 years of experience in the industry.

item2.title: Technology
item2.desc: We manufacture efficient and safe products.

item3.title: Quality
item3.desc: We offer high-quality insulation products. We are ISO 9001 certified.

item4.title: Comprehensiveness
item4.desc: We handle sales, design, production, and installation of insulation.

item1.title: How does cooperation with isoTex look like?
item1.body: Cooperation with isoTex consists of several stages. First, our employees take measurements of the installations and equipment at the client’s site. Based on the results, an individual project and quotation for the protective insulation is prepared. Once accepted by the client, we proceed to production. After manufacturing, the insulation is installed on pipelines or machines. We provide professional support at every stage. We advise on the best solutions for each case and help optimize investment costs.

item2.title: Production of insulation elements
item2.body:
The production of insulation elements is the core of isoTex's operations. We primarily create various types of insulation, covers, and mats. Their main task is to protect devices such as engines, turbines, and other installations. We use only high-quality materials with excellent thermal insulation properties and good flexibility.
We most often use fiberglass or ceramic fabrics, as they resist high temperatures and provide proper sealing and flexibility. We also use coating materials such as silicone, aluminum foil, or Teflon. We specialize in creating insulation for fittings, pipes, machines and their components, and other devices that generate high heat during operation.

image1.full: We specialize in thermal insulation. Their primary purpose is to protect industrial installations and devices from heat loss. We mainly offer: pipe insulation, pipeline insulation, and high-temperature insulation.

image2.full:
We sell flexible polyurethane foams used in upholstered furniture and mattresses. We offer foams in various densities (T and HR):
 low – from 14 to 23 kg/m3,
 medium – from 23 to 29 kg/m3,
 high – from 29 kg/m3.

image3.full:
Part of our services includes the production of turbine insulation. We mainly offer insulation mattresses. The insulation of power turbines with reusable mattresses has several advantages. This technology is:
 renewable,
 dry,
 clean.

image4.full:
Our company also manufactures insulation for engines, machines, and devices. We offer insulation mattresses whose main purpose is thermal protection and damage prevention. Our insulations are:
 tailored to the shape of the equipment,
 flexible,
 effective.

shortinfo2.heading: Thermal insulation manufacturer
shortinfo2.paragraph:
IsoTex, a manufacturer of thermal insulation, is located in Komorów, Lower Silesian Voivodeship. Our main business activities include the production, sale, and installation of components designed to protect industrial equipment and installations from heat loss. We have been providing services in this industry for nearly 30 years, starting our operations in 1994.

We encourage you to take advantage of our services!

We offer a comprehensive approach – our services include sales, design, production, and installation of insulation. The technology we use ensures that our products are efficient and safe for daily use. Customers can also rely on professional support at every stage of cooperation.

carousel.text1: We produce and sell thermal insulation. These include, for example, pipeline insulation.
carousel.text2: We offer flexible polyurethane foams, including standard T and highly elastic HR types.
carousel.text3: If you're interested in purchasing our products or using our services, feel free to contact our staff.

fabrics.glassFabricsDescription: Glass fabrics are a primary material used in the production of thermal insulation. They are highly resistant to temperatures up to 550°C, non-flammable, and resistant to most chemicals. Due to their structure, they offer durability and flexibility, making them ideal for insulating various industrial components such as pipes, valves, and turbines.
fabrics.aramidFabricsDescription: Aramid fabrics (e.g., Kevlar®) offer exceptional mechanical resistance while being resistant to high temperatures. They are used in insulation materials requiring high abrasion, tear, and vibration resistance. They are ideal for environments with intense wear, combining thermal protection with mechanical durability.
fabrics.cutPartsDescription: Cut and stamped parts made from technical fabrics are crucial in producing custom-made thermal insulation. With the ability to precisely cut materials such as glass or aramid fabric, it's possible to create components perfectly adapted to the shape of turbines, valves, elbows, and other non-standard industrial components. Optimized for dimensions and shapes, these cut elements provide effective thermal protection, ease of installation, and an aesthetically finished insulation mat.

fillings.mineralWoolDescription: Mineral wools are insulation materials made from mineral fibers, such as glass wool or rock wool. They are known for their excellent thermal and acoustic properties, making them ideal for insulating buildings, pipes, or industrial equipment. Due to their fibrous structure, mineral wools are fire-resistant and non-combustible, increasing the safety of usage.
fillings.ceramicWoolDescription: Ceramic wools are materials with high temperature resistance, used in industrial insulation. They offer excellent thermal and acoustic properties, making them perfect for insulating furnaces, boilers, and other devices operating under extreme conditions. Their fibrous structure provides effective sound dampening and minimizes heat loss.
fillings.glassMatDescription: Glass mats are insulation materials made from glass fibers, which offer excellent thermal and acoustic properties. They are lightweight, flexible, and easy to process, making them ideal for insulating buildings, pipes, and industrial equipment. Due to their fibrous structure, glass mats are fire-resistant and non-combustible, enhancing safety during use.

fabrics_info.generalDescription: Technical fabrics are specialized materials with exceptional mechanical, thermal, and chemical properties. They are used in various industries, from energy to automotive, providing effective thermal insulation, protection against high temperatures, and durability even in extreme working conditions.

glass_info.generalDescription: Glass fabrics are materials made of glass fibers that are characterized by exceptional resistance to high temperatures, fire, and chemicals. Due to these properties, they are widely used in industry, including the production of thermal insulation, welding shields, and other materials protecting against extreme conditions.
glass_info.eGlassFiberDescription: E-glass fibers are materials that offer high resistance to temperatures reaching up to 550°C. Due to their electrical properties, they are widely used in electrical and industrial insulation.
glass_info.filamentFibersDescription: Smooth, long, continuous fibers that are characterized by high mechanical strength and resistance to high temperatures.
glass_info.texturedFibersDescription: Fibers that have been subjected to texturing (crimping), increasing their volume, flexibility, and thermal insulation properties. Air trapped between fibers acts as an additional thermal barrier.
glass_info.productionProcessDescription: Glass fabrics are created by weaving glass fibers, which can be textured or filamentous, to form a durable fabric resistant to high temperatures. Their mechanical strength is the result of using high-quality glass yarns and a controlled manufacturing process.
glass_info.coatingsDescription: Glass fabrics can be coated or covered with various substances to enhance their properties.
glass_info.siliconeCoatingDescription: Silicone coating is commonly used to increase resistance to high temperatures, water, oils, and chemicals. Silicone-coated material also exhibits antistatic properties and is fire-resistant.
glass_info.vermiculiteCoatingDescription: Vermiculite is a natural mineral used as a protective coating. It increases the material's resistance to high temperatures and chemicals.
glass_info.aluminumCoatingDescription: Glass fabrics can be coated with aluminum to increase their resistance to high temperatures and better protection against thermal radiation.
glass_info.temperatureResistanceDescription: Glass fabrics show high resistance to temperatures up to 550°C (for standard E-glass fabrics), and in some special fabrics – even up to 1000°C.
glass_info.chemicalResistanceDescription: Glass fabrics are resistant to the action of many chemicals, making them ideal for use in challenging industrial conditions where contact with aggressive chemicals is common.
glass_info.flexibilityAndStrengthDescription: Thanks to the use of textured fibers, glass fabrics offer high flexibility and mechanical strength, which is particularly important in applications requiring resistance to shock and mechanical damage.
glass_info.applicationDescription: Glass fabrics find wide application in many industries, such as:
glass_info.thermalInsulationDescription: Thermo-e-glass products are used to create thermal shields that protect equipment and installations from high temperatures. Glass fabrics are used to produce thermal blankets, protective mats, sleeves, or seals.
glass_info.metalurgicalEnergyIndustryDescription: They are used in the production of protective materials for turbines, valves, pipelines, and other industrial installations that require high-temperature resistance.
glass_info.fireProtectionDescription: Glass fabrics are used as a base material for producing fire protection covers, including protective clothing, fire blankets, and shields for industrial machines.
glass_info.summaryDescription: Glass fabrics, thanks to their resistance to high temperatures, flexibility, mechanical strength, and resistance to chemical factors, are essential materials in many industries, from the production of thermal insulation materials to protective shields in harsh working conditions.

aramid_info.generalDescription: Aramid fabrics are technical materials made of aramid fibers such as Kevlar® and Twaron® that are known for their exceptional mechanical strength, resistance to cuts, abrasions, and high temperatures. Their excellent physicochemical properties make them suitable for the most demanding industrial and protective applications.
aramid_info.kevlarDescription: One of the most well-known aramid fibers, valued for its exceptional tensile strength and thermal resistance. It is used in protective equipment, aerospace, and automotive industries.
aramid_info.twaronDescription: A European equivalent of Kevlar®, with very similar properties. It is often used in the production of composite materials and personal protective equipment.
aramid_info.productionProcessDescription: Aramid fabrics are made by weaving aramid fibers in various weaves such as plain, twill, or satin. Depending on the application, they can also be reinforced, laminated, or coated with additional protective layers (e.g., neoprene, silicone, PTFE).
aramid_info.siliconeDescription: Increases resistance to weather and chemical factors.
aramid_info.aluminumDescription: Aluminum coating improves infrared radiation heat reflection.
aramid_info.thermalResistanceDescription: Aramid fabrics withstand temperatures up to around 500°C, and in short contact, even higher. They do not melt but char, making them ideal for fire-resistant applications.
aramid_info.mechanicalResistanceDescription: They are exceptionally resistant to stretching, tearing, cutting, and abrasion – significantly outperforming glass fabrics in this respect.
aramid_info.chemicalResistanceDescription: They perform well against most organic solvents and industrial chemicals.
aramid_info.lowWeightDescription: Despite their high strength, aramid fabrics are lightweight, which allows them to be used in mobile applications and protective clothing.
aramid_info.thermalAndFireProtectionDescription: Welding gloves, fire curtains, turbine shields.
aramid_info.summaryDescription: Aramid fabrics, with their unique properties – particularly resistance to temperature, cuts, and mechanical damage – are among the most advanced technical materials. They are used not only in heavy industry but also in military, medical, and aerospace technologies.

fillingInfo.title: Fillings in Thermal Insulation Mattresses: Key Materials and Their Applications
fillingInfo.description: Thermal insulation mattresses are effective solutions used in industry to protect installations from heat loss and ensure the safety of people and equipment. A key role in their effectiveness is played by the filling material, which is responsible for the thermal insulation properties, fire resistance, as well as chemical and mechanical resistance of the entire system.
fillingInfo.mainFunctions: Main Functions of Fillings in Thermal Insulation Mattresses
fillingInfo.thermalInsulationDesc: The primary function of the filling is to reduce heat loss. High-temperature industrial installations – such as pipelines, turbines, valves, or heat exchangers – require an effective barrier to prevent energy from escaping. A good filling maintains process temperature, improves energy efficiency, and reduces operational costs.
fillingInfo.highTemperatureProtectionDesc: Fillings must be resistant to extreme temperatures – both long-term and short-term (peak). Depending on the application, materials capable of withstanding temperatures from several hundred to over a thousand degrees Celsius may be used.
fillingInfo.fireSafetyDesc: Due to their non-flammable and charring properties, fillings help protect people and equipment from fire and high temperatures in the event of system failures.
fillingInfo.chemicalMechanicalResistanceDesc: In many industrial environments, resistance to moisture, oils, chemicals, vibrations, and abrasion is crucial. Proper selection of the filling material allows the mattress to be adapted to harsh working conditions.
fillingInfo.flexibilityDesc: Fillings must fit well against the insulated element – whether it is a valve, pipe elbow, or another irregular shape. Due to their structure, they can be easily molded and adapted, facilitating the installation and removal of insulation during maintenance.
fillingInfo.mineralWoolsDesc: Mineral wools are materials made from inorganic fibers such as glass or basalt. Due to their porous structure, they are excellent at limiting heat flow while also damping noise. They are non-flammable, making them indispensable in areas where fire safety is a priority – in construction, piping installations, and industrial systems.
fillingInfo.ceramicWoolsDesc: Ceramic wools are used where other materials cannot withstand temperature – in furnaces, boilers, or fire zones. Resistant to extreme conditions, they provide effective thermal barriers even above 1000°C. Their light, fibrous structure allows them to conform well to irregular surfaces, while also reducing noise.
fillingInfo.glassMatsDesc: Glass mats are lightweight, flexible materials made from thin glass fibers. They are ideal for areas requiring easy installation and processing, such as insulation of ducts, equipment, or building elements. Due to their fire resistance and good sound-damping properties, they are versatile solutions in many industries.

characteristics.title: Mineral Wool – General Characteristics
characteristics.description: Mineral wool is an insulating material made from mineral fibers, such as glass wool or rock wool. It is characterized by excellent thermal and acoustic insulation properties, as well as resistance to high temperatures, making it widely used in construction, industry, and other fields where high protection against heat, noise, and fire is required.

types.title: Types of Mineral Wool
types.description: Mineral wool comes in two main types:

glassWool.title: Glass Wool:
glassWool.description: It is a product obtained from molten glass, which is then spun into fibers, creating a material with excellent insulating properties. It is relatively lightweight and easy to process.

rockWool.title: Rock Wool (Basalt):
rockWool.description: Produced from natural basalt stones, it has slightly better thermal and acoustic insulation properties than glass wool, as well as higher resistance to high temperatures.

comparisonCard.title: Visual Comparison of Glass and Rock Mineral Wool

comparison.title: Comparison of Glass Wool and Rock Wool

thermalInsulation.rockWool: Slightly worse thermal insulation, but better fire resistance.

compressionResistance.glassWool: Lower resistance, more prone to compression.
compressionResistance.rockWool: Higher resistance, better for applications requiring high pressure.

acousticInsulation.glassWool: Very good, better at damping higher frequencies.
acousticInsulation.rockWool: Good at damping sounds, but may be less effective at higher frequencies.

vaporPermeability.rockWool: Lower, better in places requiring tight insulation.

fireResistance.rockWool: More fire-resistant, withstands up to 1000°C, does not melt.

weight.rockWool: Heavier, more durable, but harder to install.

moistureResistance.glassWool: Less resistant to moisture, can be damaged by water contact.
moistureResistance.rockWool: Better moisture resistance, does not absorb water, more resistant to mold.

application.glassWool: Thermal and acoustic insulation in construction.
application.rockWool: Industrial and fire insulation, in furnaces and boilers.

thermalInsulation.rockWool: Slightly worse thermal insulation, but better fire resistance.

compressionResistance.glassWool: Lower resistance, more prone to compression.
compressionResistance.rockWool: Higher resistance, better for applications requiring high pressure.

acousticInsulation.glassWool: Very good, better at damping higher frequencies.
acousticInsulation.rockWool: Good at damping sounds, but may be less effective at higher frequencies.

vaporPermeability.rockWool: Lower, better in places requiring tight insulation.

fireResistance.rockWool: More fire-resistant, withstands up to 1000°C, does not melt.

weight.rockWool: Heavier, more durable, but harder to install.

moistureResistance.glassWool: Less resistant to moisture, can be damaged by water contact.
moistureResistance.rockWool: Better moisture resistance, does not absorb water, more resistant to mold.

application.glassWool: Thermal and acoustic insulation in construction.
application.rockWool: Industrial and fire insulation, in furnaces and boilers.

production.title: Mineral Wool Production Process
production.description: Mineral wool is produced by melting mineral raw materials in high-temperature furnaces and then spinning them into fine fibers. These fibers are then formed into mats, boards, or granules that can be used as insulating materials. The production of mineral wool is a process that requires precise temperature and time management to ensure optimal material properties.

coatings.title: Coatings and Coverings
coatings.description: Mineral wool can be coated with various substances to enhance its properties:

aluminum.title: Aluminum Coating -
aluminum.description: Used to increase the material's resistance to moisture, improve its insulating properties, and enhance resistance to chemicals.

glassFiber.title: Glass Fiber Coating -
glassFiber.description: Increases the mechanical strength of the material and protects it from mechanical damage.

glassFiberCard.title: Mineral Wool with Glass Fiber Coating

properties.title: Properties of Mineral Wool
properties.description: Mineral wool has a range of beneficial properties that make it one of the most commonly used insulating materials:

highTemperature.title: High-Temperature Resistance:
highTemperature.description: Mineral wool exhibits very high resistance to fire, making it an excellent material for fireproof insulation. Depending on the type of wool, temperature resistance can range from 350°C to even 1000°C.

thermalInsulation.title: Thermal Insulation:
thermalInsulation.description: Due to its fiber structure, mineral wool effectively insulates against heat, reducing heating costs in buildings and protecting industrial equipment from excessive heating.

acousticInsulation.title: Acoustic Insulation:
acousticInsulation.description: This material effectively dampens sounds, making it an ideal solution in construction, especially for multi-story and industrial buildings where noise can be an issue.

chemicalResistance.title: Chemical Resistance:
chemicalResistance.description: Mineral wool is resistant to many chemicals, making it suitable for harsh industrial conditions where it is exposed to aggressive substances.

applications.title: Applications of Mineral Wool
applications.description: Mineral wool is widely used in many industries:

buildingInsulation.title: Building Insulation:
buildingInsulation.description: It is commonly used in construction, in both residential and industrial buildings, as an insulating material for walls, roofs, floors, and pipes. Mineral wool significantly improves the energy efficiency of buildings.

industrialInsulation.title: Industrial Insulation:
industrialInsulation.description: Used in industry to insulate equipment such as boilers, furnaces, pipelines, or reactors where high temperatures occur. Due to its fire resistance, this material effectively protects against overheating and reduces fire risks.

acousticInsulation.title: Acoustic Insulation:
acousticInsulation.description: Used to dampen noise in offices, production halls, conference rooms, or other facilities where sound level control is required.

fireProtection.title: Fire Protection:
fireProtection.description: Mineral wool is used in the production of protective clothing, fireproof blankets, and other fire protection materials.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Mineral wool is an extremely versatile material that, thanks to its fire resistance, high insulating properties, and chemical resistance, is widely used in various industries. From construction to industry, it is indispensable in creating effective insulation and fire protection systems, making it one of the most important insulating materials on the market.

characteristics.title: Ceramic Wool – General Characteristics
characteristics.description: Ceramic wool is a high-temperature insulating material made from ceramic fibers, typically based on aluminum oxide and silica. Due to its exceptional resistance to extreme temperatures and excellent thermal insulation properties, it is used in the most demanding industrial conditions, such as furnaces, boilers, or power generation installations.
characteristics.description2: This material is lightweight, flexible, and easy to shape, making it suitable for hard-to-reach areas or irregular surfaces. It is resistant to thermal shocks, does not conduct heat, and does not react with most chemicals.

highTemperature.title: Resistance to Extreme Temperatures:
highTemperature.description: Ceramic wool can operate at temperatures from 800°C to as high as 1400°C, depending on its chemical composition. It is non-flammable and does not melt, making it an ideal choice for fire and thermal applications.

lowConductivity.title: Low Thermal Conductivity:
lowConductivity.description: Thanks to its fibrous structure, it retains heat within devices and installations, reducing energy losses.

chemicalResistance.title: Chemical Resistance:
chemicalResistance.description: This material does not react with most acids, alkalis, and industrial gases, making it suitable for aggressive industrial environments.

lightweight.title: Lightweight and Easy Installation:
lightweight.description: Ceramic wool is significantly lighter than traditional refractory materials, facilitating its transport, processing, and installation.

thermalShock.title: Thermal Shock Resistance:
thermalShock.description: It does not get damaged by sudden temperature changes, which is crucial in installations that are cyclically heated and cooled.

forms.title: Forms and Coatings
forms.description: Ceramic wool is available in many forms: mats, ropes, paper, blankets, or vacuum-formed modules. Depending on the requirements, it can also be coated with special protective layers, such as:

aluminum.title: Aluminum Coatings:
aluminum.description: Improve aesthetics, increase moisture resistance, and reflect radiant heat.

technicalFabrics.title: Technical Fabrics:
technicalFabrics.description: Such as coatings made of glass or silica fibers, which protect against mechanical damage and enhance product durability.

applications.title: Applications of Ceramic Wool
applications.description: Ceramic wool is used wherever effective insulation is required in extreme conditions:

energyIndustry.title: Energy Industry:
energyIndustry.description: For insulating turbines, boilers, steam pipelines, and combustion chambers.

metallurgy.title: Metallurgy and Foundries:
metallurgy.description: For lining furnaces, foundries, and transport channels for molten metals.

petrochemical.title: Petrochemical and Chemical Industry:
petrochemical.description: For insulating tanks and reactors exposed to high temperatures and chemical substances.

heatingDevices.title: Production of Heating Devices:
heatingDevices.description: In boilers, laboratory furnaces, industrial dryers, or heaters.

fireProtection.title: Fire Protection:
fireProtection.description: In passive fire protection systems, fire-resistant doors, and thermal barriers.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Ceramic wool is a technologically advanced insulating material designed for the most demanding industrial applications. Thanks to its resistance to extreme temperatures, thermal shocks, and chemical substances, it provides not only thermal protection but also operational safety. Its versatility, lightweight nature, and ease of installation make it a preferred component in insulation systems across many industries.

characteristics.title: Glass Mats – Properties, Applications, and Advantages
characteristics.description: Glass mats are insulating materials made from thin glass fibers, forming a compact, flexible structure resembling cotton or fabric. They are characterized by low density, good thermal resistance, and excellent acoustic insulation. Due to their lightweight nature and ease of processing, these mats are widely used in both construction and industry.

properties.title: Characteristics and Properties
properties.description: Glass fiber mats stand out with a range of beneficial features:

highTemperature.title: High-Temperature Resistance:
highTemperature.description: Glass mats can withstand temperatures of 500–600°C, making them suitable for thermal insulation in industrial environments.

nonFlammability.title: Non-Flammability:
nonFlammability.description: Glass fibers are non-flammable, and their structure prevents the spread of fire.

flexibility.title: Flexibility and Ease of Shaping:
flexibility.description: Mats can be easily cut and adapted to irregular shapes, significantly simplifying their installation.

chemicalResistance.title: Chemical Resistance:
chemicalResistance.description: The material is resistant to many aggressive chemicals, including oils, solvents, and vapors.

biologicalResistance.title: Biological Corrosion Resistance:
biologicalResistance.description: Mats do not rot, do not degrade under moisture, and do not provide an environment conducive to mold growth.

acousticInsulation.title: Acoustic Insulation:
acousticInsulation.description: The fibrous structure allows for effective sound absorption and noise reduction.

csm.description: Randomly arranged short glass fibers bonded with a binder
csm.applications: Resin composites, automotive parts, technical covers

emulsion.description: CSM with emulsion – more flexible and easier to shape

powder.description: CSM with powder – stiffer, stable for large surfaces
powder.applications: Thermal insulation coverings, e.g., for boilers, turbines, pipelines

needle.description: Mechanically bonded fibers without binder – elastic, durable
needle.applications: Acoustic and thermal insulation in industry and buildings

coated.description: Coated with aluminum foil or technical fabric – resistant to damage
coated.applications: Insulating mattresses, engine compartments, valves, turbines

loose.description: Light structure without binder or with minimal amount

automotive.description: Reinforced CSM mat for harsh conditions
automotive.applications: Thermal and acoustic insulation in vehicles

csm.description: Randomly arranged short glass fibers bonded with a binder
csm.applications: Resin composites, automotive parts, technical covers

emulsion.description: CSM with emulsion – more flexible and easier to shape

powder.description: CSM with powder – stiffer, stable for large surfaces
powder.applications: Thermal insulation coverings, e.g., for boilers, turbines, pipelines

needle.description: Mechanically bonded fibers without binder – elastic, durable
needle.applications: Acoustic and thermal insulation in industry and buildings

coated.description: Coated with aluminum foil or technical fabric – resistant to damage
coated.applications: Insulating mattresses, engine compartments, valves, turbines

loose.description: Light structure without binder or with minimal amount

automotive.description: Reinforced CSM mat for harsh conditions
automotive.applications: Thermal and acoustic insulation in vehicles

lightweight.title: Lightweight and Easy Installation
lightweight.description: Glass mats are lightweight, facilitating transport and installation. They can be easily cut and shaped, speeding up installation even in hard-to-reach areas.

flexibility.title: High Flexibility and Shape Adaptability
flexibility.description: They are highly flexible, ensuring good adhesion to irregular surfaces, valves, or pipes. They provide tight insulation without thermal bridges.

durability.title: High Durability and Resistance to External Factors
durability.description: Resistant to mechanical damage, moisture, mold, and most chemicals. They retain insulating properties for a long time, even in harsh industrial conditions.

fireSafety.title: Fire Safety
fireSafety.description: Non-flammable (Class A1), they do not melt easily and do not emit harmful gases. Suitable where fire protection is required.

noiseReduction.title: Noise Reduction Capability
noiseReduction.description: Thanks to their fibrous structure, they effectively absorb sounds. Used in acoustic partitions and for soundproofing machines, ventilation ducts, or partition walls.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Glass mats are a versatile insulating material that combines high insulation efficiency, fire and chemical resistance, and ease of processing. Their use in industry and construction enables the creation of durable, effective, and safe insulation systems. They are also an excellent filling for insulating mattresses used in areas exposed to high temperatures and noise.

Modal.Title: Procesing of Personal Data Information
Modal.Body: The administrator of your personal data is ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa based in Syców, ul. Daszyńskiego 9a, 56-500 Syców. Your personal data will be processed for the purpose of recruitment for the position you are applying for. You have the right to access the content of your data and to correct it. Providing data is voluntary but necessary to conduct the recruitment process.

PrivacyPolicy.title: PRIVACY POLICY OF THE WEBSITE www.isotex-poland.com

introduction.p1: The protection of Users' privacy is particularly important to ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa. For this reason, Users of the Website www.isotex-poland.com are guaranteed high standards of privacy protection. ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa, as the Data Controller, ensures the security of data provided by Users.
introduction.p2: The Controller's goal is also to properly inform Users about their rights and obligations related to the processing of personal data, particularly in light of the provisions on personal data protection set out in Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (hereinafter referred to as 'GDPR'). Therefore, to protect the privacy of Website Users, in this document, the Controller informs about the legal basis for processing personal data provided by Users in connection with their use of the Website www.isotex-poland.com (hereinafter referred to as the 'Website'), the methods of collecting, processing, and protecting personal data, as well as the rights of Users.
introduction.p3: A User is any natural person whose data is concerned, using the website www.isotex-poland.com or electronic services available through the Website.
introduction.p4: The Controller of personal data provided by the User on the Website www.isotex-poland.com is ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa, Komorów 9A, 56-500 Syców, NIP 9111824789 (hereinafter referred to as the 'Controller').

userConsent.title: USER CONSENT
userConsent.p1: Using the Website www.isotex-poland.com by the User means that the User accepts that the Controller collects and uses personal data in accordance with this Privacy Policy.
userConsent.p2: The personal data of the Website User is processed by the Controller based on their consent, and in some cases described in this document, within the legitimate interest of the Controller. The User has the right to withdraw their previously given consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
userConsent.p3: In the event of a change to this Privacy Policy, and the User continues to use the Website, this is deemed as consent to the current terms of the Privacy Policy.

personalData.title: PERSONAL DATA PROCESSED BY THE CONTROLLER

acquisition.title: Method of Obtaining Personal Data
acquisition.p1: The Controller obtains personal data directly from the User through the Website, via its available functionalities and communication tools, and by sending messages to the Controller through them.
acquisition.p2: Providing personal data by the User is voluntary.

types.title: Types of Processed Personal Data
types.p1: The Controller collects the following personal data concerning the User through the Website:

purposes.title: PURPOSES OF PROCESSING PERSONAL DATA
purposes.p1: The manner in which the Controller processes data concerning the User depends on the User's use of the Website and its available functionalities. The Controller processes the User's personal data for the following purposes:

communication.title: Communication with the User.
communication.p1: The Controller uses the User's personal data to communicate with them in a personalized manner. The information communicated to the User concerns offered products or services, personal data security, network updates, reminders, but also suggested offers from the Controller or its partners. Communication with the User also pertains to User support. Personal data is used to assist the User, resolve technical issues, and respond to their complaints or claims.

electronicOffers.title: Presenting Commercial Offers to the User Electronically.
electronicOffers.p1: The purpose of using the User's personal data provided through the Website's communication functionalities and tools is marketing communication conducted by the Controller as part of its business activities, particularly presenting commercial offers to the User electronically.

phoneOffers.title: Presenting Commercial Offers to the User via Telephone Contact.
phoneOffers.p1: The purpose of using the User's personal data provided through the Website's communication functionalities and tools is marketing communication conducted by the Controller as part of its business activities, particularly by presenting commercial offers to the User via telephone contact.

newsletter.title: Sending Information to the User Electronically as Part of the Controller's Newsletter Subscription.
newsletter.p1: The purpose of using the User's personal data provided through the Controller's newsletter subscription form available on the Website is to inform the User electronically (via e-mail) about new products, services, promotions, or events of the Controller or its partners.

comments.title: Enabling the User to Submit Comments or Opinions.
comments.p1: The Controller uses the User's personal data to enable them to comment on or provide opinions about the activities, services, or products of the Controller or entities cooperating with it.

additional.p1: The Controller may process the User's personal data obtained through the Website also for the following purposes:
additional.li1: to conclude and perform any contract between the User and the Controller and to provide services to the User as a client of the Controller in accordance with Article 6(1)(b) of the GDPR;
additional.li2: to conduct financial settlements with the User who is a client of the Controller for the performance of any contract concluded between the parties, as well as potential claims from the User who is a client within the legitimate interest of the Controller in accordance with Article 6(1)(f) of the GDPR, and to fulfill the Controller's legal obligations towards tax authorities based on separate regulations in accordance with Article 6(1)(c) of the GDPR;
additional.li3: to carry out the Controller's marketing activities within the legitimate interest of the Controller within the meaning of Article 6(1)(f) of the GDPR, as well as in accordance with the User's declarations of intent regarding marketing communication provided to the Controller. Consents given for marketing communication (e.g., for sending commercial information electronically or telephone contact for direct marketing purposes) may be withdrawn at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal;
additional.li4: to fulfill the Controller's legal obligations towards the User as specified in the GDPR, within the meaning of Article 6(1)(c) of the GDPR.

sharing.title: SHARING PERSONAL DATA
sharing.p1: The User's personal data is not transferred by the Controller to third parties.

rights.title: User Rights
rights.p1: At every stage of the processing of their data, the User is granted a number of rights allowing them to access their data, verify the correctness of data processing, correct it, as well as object to its processing, request the deletion of data, restriction of processing, or data portability.
rights.p2: If the User wishes to exercise their rights as a data subject, they may contact the Controller using the following contact details: ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa, Komorów 9A, 56-500 Syców, isotex.biuro@wp.pl.

complaint.title: Right to Lodge a Complaint with a Supervisory Authority
complaint.p1: The User whose personal data is processed by the Controller has the right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority responsible for personal data protection (President of the Personal Data Protection Office).

cookies.title: COOKIES
cookies.p1: The Controller informs that while using the Website, fragments of code called 'cookies,' which are text files corresponding to HTTP requests sent to the Controller's server, are stored on the User's end device. Cookies are installed by every browser through which the User visits the Website. Cookies are used on the Website for the following purposes:
cookies.li1: maintaining the technical correctness and continuity of the session between the Website server and the User's end device;
cookies.li2: optimizing the User's use of the Website's pages and adjusting their display on the User's end device;
cookies.li3: ensuring the security of using the Website;
cookies.li4: collecting statistics on visits to the Website's pages to support improving their structure and content;
cookies.li5: displaying content tailored to the User's preferences on their end device.
cookies.p2: Detailed information regarding the cookies used by the Controller and their management is available in the Cookie Policy.

security.title: Protection of Personal Data Security
security.p1: The Controller implements appropriate measures to ensure the security of the User's personal data. Secure use of the Website is ensured by the systems and procedures applied to protect against access and disclosure of data to unauthorized persons. Furthermore, the systems and processes used by the Controller are regularly monitored to detect potential threats. Personal data obtained by the Controller is stored in computer systems with strictly limited access.

storage.title: Storage of Personal Data
storage.p1: The period of storage of Users' personal data depends on the purposes of data processing by the Controller.
storage.p2: The Controller stores personal data for the period necessary to achieve specific purposes, i.e.:
storage.li1: in the case of providing a service/delivering a product to the User - for the period necessary for the Controller to perform the ordered service or deliver the product to the User.
storage.p3: In each of the above cases, after the necessary processing period, the data may be processed only for the purpose of pursuing claims arising from the relationship between the parties until the final resolution of such claims through legal proceedings.

changes.title: Changes to the Privacy Policy
changes.p1: To update the information contained in this Privacy Policy and ensure its compliance with applicable law, this Privacy Policy may be subject to change. In the event of a change in the content of the Privacy Policy, the date of its update indicated at the end of the text will be changed. To obtain information on the method of personal data protection, the Controller recommends that Users regularly review the provisions of the Privacy Policy.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.p1: To obtain any information regarding this Privacy Policy, the User may contact the Data Controller: ISOTEX GROUP Ilona Żurawa, Komorów 9A, 56-500 Syców, using the following contact details: isotex.biuro@wp.pl.
contact.p2: Additionally, it is also possible to contact by post at the address: Komorów 9A, 56-500 Syców.

update.p1: The last update of this document took place on 12.01.2023.

ISO90012015.Certdesc:
ISO 9001:2015 is an international standard that defines the requirements for a Quality Management System (QMS). The ISO 9001:2015 certificate is recognized and widely applied across the globe.
 The ISO 9001:2015 system provides guidelines for developing principles and procedures necessary to deliver products and services that meet customer needs and legal requirements. It outlines various areas that impact effective quality management, such as customer focus, involvement of top management and employees, planning, implementation, monitoring of processes, and continuous improvement.
 Organizations holding an ISO 9001:2015 certificate guarantee that their products and services meet specified standards, which helps expand their potential customer base.
 The ISO 9001:2015 system is compatible with other management systems such as ISO 14001:2015. Thanks to the alignment with Annex SL, integrating management systems is more effective.

MoreInfo.desc: More information about ISO 9001:2015 is available here:

Hygienic_Certificate.Certdesc: The NIZP-PZH-BBK Hygienic Certificate confirms that our insulation mattresses are safe for human health and suitable for use in environments requiring high hygiene standards. Issued by the National Institute of Public Health – National Institute of Hygiene, the certificate guarantees that our products do not emit harmful substances and can be safely used in industrial, food, or pharmaceutical facilities.

MoreInfo.desc: More information about the hygienic certificate is available here:

Banner.title: Comprehensive solutions for thermal insulation
Banner.description: Heat losses in industrial installations are a costly problem – we have a solution! We will design and manufacture insulation mattresses that increase the efficiency of your systems.
Banner.cta_text: Discover our solutions and reduce CO2 emissions now!

WhatWeOfferBanner.paragraph1: Our offer includes a wide range of high-quality products, including modern insulation mattresses, top-quality izo-standard mattresses that meet the highest standards of thermal and acoustic insulation, as well as durable technical fabrics and a comprehensive set of accessories necessary for various projects.
WhatWeOfferBanner.paragraph2: We also provide professional cutting services for fabrics and other materials using advanced CNC technology, ensuring precision and efficiency at every stage of production. Our solutions are designed with customer needs in mind, offering reliability and customization to specific requirements, making us a leader in the insulation and special techniques industry.

Catalog.title: Check out our latest catalog!
Catalog.description: We offer modern insulation systems, including: high-quality insulation mattresses, IZO-standard mattresses meeting the highest standards, durable technical fabrics, and a wide range of accessories. We invite you to explore our offer and discover reliable solutions tailored to your needs.

card1.title: Quality
card1.description: Our thermal insulations meet strict standards, as confirmed by ISO 9001 certificates. We use the best materials, such as mineral wool, glass wool, and ceramic wool, to ensure durability and efficiency. This guarantees the reliability of our products even in the most demanding industrial conditions.

card2.title: Technology
card2.description: We utilize 3D CAD design, allowing precise customization of insulation to your needs. Our advanced manufacturing processes use high-quality materials like mineral wool, silicone, and Teflon, ensuring safety and performance. We also apply renewable technologies, minimizing environmental impact and enhancing the energy efficiency of your installations.

card3.title: Experience
card3.description: Since 1994, we have been gaining expertise that translates into excellent thermal insulations. Over the past 30 years, we have completed projects in Poland and abroad, earning the trust of clients worldwide. Our experience allows us to offer solutions perfectly tailored to the specific requirements of every industry.

product1.title: Insulation mattresses
product1.description: High-quality insulation mattresses providing excellent thermal and acoustic protection, tailored to industrial needs.

product2.title: Fabrics
product2.description: Durable and resistant technical fabrics, ideal for specialized applications in insulation and industrial protection.

product3.title: Fillings
product3.description: Fillings made of mineral and glass wool, offering excellent insulation and safety in demanding conditions.

product4.title: Accessories
product4.description: A comprehensive set of accessories supporting the installation and maintenance of insulation at the highest level.

Parallax.title: Looking for a reliable partner to carry out your project?
Parallax.description: Since its inception, Isotex Group has focused on quality and innovation in the field of thermal insulation. Our company holds numerous certificates confirming the highest standards, ensuring professional execution and safety at every stage of the project.

AboutUsPage.title: Get to know Isotex Group better

section1.title: IsoTex – Experts in thermal insulation since 1994
section1.description: Since 1994, we have been producing high-quality thermal insulations that effectively protect against heat loss. Our insulation mattresses are designed with attention to every detail to ensure optimal performance of your installations.

section2.title: Comprehensive solutions for your industry
section2.description: At IsoTex, we not only produce insulation but also offer professional on-site installation. Thanks to 3D CAD design, our mattresses ensure precise fit and minimize heat loss in industrial installations.

section3.title: Commitment to sustainability
section3.description: Our thermal insulations help prevent heat loss, supporting energy efficiency and reducing CO2 emissions. We produce and install solutions that care for the environment and your business.

cta.title: Want to learn more?
cta.description: Contact us to discuss how our modern solutions can improve the efficiency of your installations.

OrderProcedure.title: Order execution process at Isotex Group

step1.title: Exploring our offer
step1.description: Discover our wide range of insulation mattresses and services. Contact us to receive detailed information about our products and their applications.

step2.title: Measurements and consultation
step2.description: Our specialists will conduct precise measurements of your installation and advise on the best solutions. We use 3D CAD technology for accurate design.

step3.title: Project preparation and quotation
step3.description: Based on the measurements, we will prepare a customized insulation project and provide a detailed quotation. We adapt to your needs and budget.

step4.title: Placing the order
step4.description: After project approval, you can place your order. We offer fast execution thanks to advanced manufacturing processes.

step5.title: Production and installation
step5.description: Once the order is placed, we begin producing the insulation mattresses. After production, we deliver them to the specified address or perform professional on-site installation.

WhatWeOffer.title: Comprehensive support at every stage
WhatWeOffer.description: At IsoTex Group, we provide comprehensive support to deliver the best thermal insulation solutions. From the first contact to the final installation, we assist you every step of the way, ensuring the quality and efficiency of your installations. Our services include:

item1.title: Measurements:
item1.description: We conduct detailed measurements of your installation to ensure a perfect fit for the insulation.

item2.title: Customized design:
item2.description: We create a personalized design that meets the specific requirements of your system.

item3.title: Selection of components:
item3.description: We choose the best solutions and materials to guarantee durability and efficiency.

item4.title: Production:
item4.description: We manufacture insulation mattresses while maintaining the highest quality standards.

item5.title: Installation:
item5.description: Our specialists perform professional on-site installation, ensuring a seamless process.

WhatWeOffer.image_alt: Image of Isotex Group comprehensive support

hero.title: Technology at IsoTex – Precision and Innovation
hero.description: At IsoTex Group, we combine years of experience with modern technologies to deliver top-quality thermal insulation. Learn about our production process and discover how we create insulation mattresses that meet the most demanding standards.

section1.title: Our Production Process – Step by Step
section1.description: Every project at IsoTex Group is executed with attention to detail to ensure the best results. Our production process includes the following stages:

item1.title: Order Acceptance:
item1.description: We start by accepting the order and conducting a detailed analysis of the client's needs.

item2.title: Design According to Specifications:
item2.description: We create a customized design, taking into account the specific requirements of the installation, using 3D CAD technology.

item3.title: Precision Production:
item3.description: The finalized design goes into production, where we use modern technologies, such as a cutter for template cutting, ensuring the highest precision.

section2.title: Materials and Components – Quality in Every Detail
section2.description: We use carefully selected materials, fillings, and fastenings to produce our insulation mattresses, ensuring durability and efficiency. We offer a wide range of components, such as:

item1.title: Outer Materials:
item1.description: Mineral wool, Teflon, silicone, and others.

item2.title: Fillings:
item2.description: Ceramic wool, aluminum foil, and other solutions.

item3.title: Fastenings:
item3.description: Hooks, Velcro, straps – for easy installation and removal.

section3.title: Cutter – Guarantee of Precision
section3.description: At IsoTex Group, we rely on modern technologies to ensure the highest quality. We use a cutter for template cutting, enabling unparalleled precision and repeatability in the production of insulation mattresses.

cta.title: Want to learn more about our technology?
cta.description: Contact us to discuss how our modern solutions can enhance the efficiency of your installations.

hero.title: Fastenings at IsoTex – Tailored to Your Needs
hero.description: At IsoTex Group, we use various types of fastenings to ensure our insulation mattresses are easy to install and remove while remaining durable in all conditions. Learn about our solutions and how we select fastenings based on the application.

slider1.title: Velcro – Simplicity and Convenience
slider1.description: We use Velcro for temperatures up to 180°C, offering the simplest and fastest installation and removal. This is the ideal solution for installations requiring frequent access.

slider2.title: Buckles – Durability in Harsh Conditions
slider2.description: Buckles are used when temperatures exceed 180°C to prevent damage to Velcro. They are ideal for outdoor installations where Velcro may lose adhesion due to rain.

slider3.title: Hooks – Specialized Solution for Turbines
slider3.description: Hooks are primarily used in turbine mattresses. Adjacent mattresses are connected with wire, ensuring stability and precise fit in demanding installations.
